com.yazdankhah.cipher.type

Class Reg

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yazdankhah.cipher.type.Reg

  • public final class Reg
extends java.lang.Object
    Simulates a general purpose shift register.
    Author:
    ahmad

      • Reg

        public Reg(java.lang.String name,

      • Reg

        public Reg(java.lang.String name,
           int size,
           java.lang.String valStr,
           Reg.STR_TYPE type)
    throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates a new object of Reg. If number of bits in ValStr is less than provided size, it would be Left-padded with '0', but if it is more, then it would be truncated from the right. The bits are numbered from left-to-right.
        Parameters:
        name -
        size -
        valStr -
        type -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

    • Method Detail

      • initializeVal

        public void initializeVal(java.lang.String valStr,
                          Reg.STR_TYPE type)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Initializes the shift register. The string can contain string of binary or hex numbers or characters. If the size of the register is smaller than the value, it'd be truncated. You might use underscore for separating the binary digits or hex digits. For example, initialize("1_1101_0001", INIT_TYPE.BIN) initialize("ff_cba0", INIT_TYPE.HEX) ; the hex number can be in upper-case too. initialize("I am student.", INIT_TYPE.STR)
        Parameters:
        valStr -
        type -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • xor

        public void xor(Reg in)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        XORs the content of the given Shift Register with the content of this object and put the result in this object. It assumes the size of both are the same.
        Parameters:
        in - the input shift register.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the logical pos and/or bit is not valid.

        Returns:

        Throws:
